Message.Title: With Windows 8.1, Surface RT Far Better for Business and Education
Message.Msg: SOURCE: ITBusinessEdge article by Rob Enderle, July 1 "We are getting close to a Surface update (looks like NVIDIA Tegra 4) ...."" Wrapping Up: Windows 8.1 (Blue) Makes RT Real ""In the end, Windows 8.1, which used to be called Windows Blue, makes Windows RT real and vastly more usable than it was in its .0 iteration. Nice thing about a software fix is my old Surface RT tablet will be automatically upgraded to 8.1 when it comes out and the upgrade, based on what I saw at Build, is pretty seamless. I’ve been playing with 8.1 on a Surface Pro tablet and there really is a lot to love here, but I love it far more on Surface RT.""

Message.Title: scre wish banks fined (again)
Message.Msg: BRUSSELS—European antitrust authorities charged 13 of the world's largest investment banks (most of them screwish) on Monday with colluding to prevent the lucrative global business of trading credit derivatives from moving onto regulated exchanges and away from markets controlled by the banks. The charges against the banks are another black eye for the multitrillion-dollar market for credit-default swaps, the derivatives that act as insurance against a debt default by a company or a government. These derivatives were blamed for accelerating the spread of the financial crisis after the collapse of Lehman Brothers Inc. in 2008 by allowing banks and other financial institutions to take on huge risks with little oversight from regulators. EU regulators say banks fought plans to trade swaps on exchanges because of potential hits to profits. Now, European authorities say the banks, including screwish Goldman Sachs Group Inc., screwish J.P. Morgan Chase JPM , and screwish Deutsche Bank AG, conspired to prevent trading from moving onto potentially less risky, more-transparent platforms, where their profits would be significantly lower.
I was thinking the same thing.....perhaps the reason for the delay?

Topic.Title: AMD kicked back to its $3 hole

Message.Msg: I bought a sizable amount of AMD at 3 & change and I'm up 25% so far. Bought on the console news, and the many initiatives they have announced. They will go up at next earnings due to them not losing as much money as expected. They still have to execute at some point, but for now I think they will go to the 5-6 range and will sell then.

Topic.Title: AMD kicked back to its $3 hole

Message.Msg: I would watch for a gap of a quarter or two between the recent positive news and the actual revenues resulting from the news. Will their PR be able to carry them through that dry spell without the stock giving back some of the recent gains? If you have confidence for the long term, you might do well to hold, but I would definitely consider the possibility of some give-back in between now and success.
